title: Manchester City revive Aymeric Laporte transfer interest despite his £55million buyout clause
text:

Manchester City will make a renewed bid to land Athletic Bilbao’s Aymeric Laporte in the summer. 
Pep Guardiola is refusing to give up on bringing the 22-year-old central defender to the Blues , despite being snubbed by him last summer. 
City had a £39million deal lined up for the Frenchman, only for him to sign a new four-year contract with Bilbao after being set a deadline by Guardiola. 
Laporte now has a buy-out clause of £55m – but that will not put the Blues off as they search for a long-term partner for John Stones. 
And they have been encouraged by the player’s recent admission that he will look at fresh offers at the end of the season. Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Share this video Watch Next 
City have also been running the rule over Southampton centre-back Virgil van Dijk but Saints have slapped a £50m valuation on the Dutchman. 
Guardiola believes Laporte offers better value for money, even though he is yet to make his full international debut for France. Southampton's asking price for Van Dijk has Man City looking elsewehere (Photo: Getty) 
That’s why the City boss has sanctioned a six-month loan deal for Bayern Munich defender Holger Badstuber. 
The 27-year-old is fit again after four injury-ravaged years and Guardiola, who worked with the German international at Bayern, is desperate for defensive reinforcements after seeing skipper Vincent Kompany once again struggle with injuries. Guardiola is set to borrow his former Bayern star Badstuber for the rest of the season (Photo: Bongarts/Getty) 
Badstuber is out of contract at the end of the season and Bayern want him to sign a new deal before allowing the loan to go through. 
The Bavarians see a temporary switch to City as an ideal opportunity to get their popular centre-back playing again. Like us on Facebook
